const ParticleManager &  particles 
)

boundary particle list for all boundray particles

constructor

Author:
Xiangyu Hu <Xiangyu.Hu@aer.mw.tum.de>

changes by: Martin Bernreuther <Martin.Bernreuther@ipvs.uni-stuttgart.de>

copy global properties from initiation class

  • reading key words and configuration data from input file
    Todo:
    {prehaps also implement an open boundary condition. at the moment shock tube simulations are done with "artificial" open edge by defining the domain from 0 til 3.9 and only placing particles from 1-3, so whatever boundary condition is precised for xbl and xbr in the initiation file (tcl) it practically has no effect.}

boundary conditions

  • west side

    • the rigid wall conditions

    • the perodic or symmetry conditions

void Boundary::BuildBoundaryParticle ( ParticleManager &  particles,
Hydrodynamics &  hydro 
)

build boundary particles

  • clear boundary particles list

  • boundary condition for each side

    • west side: test boundary parameter for one of the following cases and then build the appropriate boundary particles

      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

      create a new particle identical to old particle ("copy")(boost creats smart pointer and the corresponding object)

      boundary condition (modify properties of copied particle accroding to boundary condition)

    • east side

      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

    • south side

      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

    • north side

      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

  • considering the coner cells

    • south-west corner
      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

    • north-west corner

      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

    • north-east corner

      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

    • south-east corner

      • the rigid wall conditions

      • the symmetry conditions

      • the perodic conditions

void Boundary::RunAwayCheck ( Hydrodynamics &  hydro  ) 

check particle if particle run out of the computational domain

  • iterate the partilce list

  • only checking real particles (for all boundaries)

Here is the caller graph for this function:

Member Data Documentation

int Boundary::xBl

boundary condition indicator left hand side

  • 0: wall boundary condition
  • 1: perodic boundary condition
  • 2: free slip wall boundary condition
  • 3: symmetry boundary condition

int Boundary::xBr

boundary condition indicator right hand side

  • 0: wall boundary condition
  • 1: perodic boundary condition
  • 2: free slip wall boundary condition
  • 3: symmetry boundary condition

int Boundary::yBd

boundary condition indicator bottom side

  • 0: wall boundary condition
  • 1: perodic boundary condition
  • 2: free slip wall boundary condition
  • 3: symmetry boundary condition

int Boundary::yBu

boundary condition indicator upper side

  • 0: wall boundary condition
  • 1: perodic boundary condition
  • 2: free slip wall boundary condition
  • 3: symmetry boundary condition
